name: Paradise Lodge & Bungalows

reviews.text: We stayed for a few days whilst travelling through. Location is close to lake Louise but on the main lake Louise road so bit of traffic noise and quite busy.
reviews.title: Rustic old fashioned feel and look worked got a short stay.

reviews.text: We stayed in a cooper cabin, my husband described it as a "large garden shed" but it's fair to call it a basic timber cabin! the downside is its layout - one room with a bathroom and a mountain view balcony, however the balcony/ deck is only accessible from outside by the track/ car parking bay as its next to the bathroom. So great views from the bathroom but all you can see from rest of cabin is other cabins and cars!
reviews.title: Gorgeous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a bit dark but nicely furnished, no wardrobe space so suits a shorter stay I think. Bed a bit noisy so not an ideal lication if you are honeymooning!!! ;0) Bathroom has nice bath etc but very very very noisy fan (think jet engine and you will be close.
reviews.title: Professionalism at its best
Bad customer service
reviews.text: On the plus side Shelley at reception was superb - a lovely warm welcome, we'd arrived early (2pm) but it was no trouble as our room was ready. She was very helpful and informative and fun with it. Highly recommended service .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So to sum up - great service, helpful reception staff, cosy but basic cabins not quite paradise but certainly functional.
reviews.title: Shame about the bed!!
Beautiful cabin in great location
reviews.text: We were very happy to be in a quiet little oasis in Lake Louise. The proximity to Lake Louise made an early morning hike there easy. We made all our breakfasts in the cabin to save time and the staff was very good at helping us find good dinner spots in town. We were able to do some mid-trip laundry and there was even a little playground for the kids while I did it. Great spot for families!

reviews.title: Quiet and cozy
reviews.text: In the hustle and bustle of Lake Louise this was a beautiful spot. Located on the road up the mountain to Lake Louise this oasis was so quiet and peaceful. Don't get me wrong the view at Lake Louise is spectacular the crowds are not. With tour bus after tour bus arriving it's was so nice to find a place that wasn't overrun with five minute tourist.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paradise bunglows has several private seating areas located around the property each with a new view of the mountains and the valley below. The staff were very helpful and friendly. What a great spot! It is our new favourite spot in Lake Louise.
reviews.title: Awesome stay with great helpful staff

reviews.text: This place is well maintain, very clean and spacious. Staff were very helpful, I was not feeling well at that time and ask the staff on information of clinic around that area, they not only give me the info but also volunteer to help me call and check that the doc is there and help me arrange an appt with the doc for me :D
reviews.title: Cleaniest accomodation EVER

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights.The front staff were very helpful & friendy, the location is only minutes by car to Lake Louise and the room is one of the cleaniest I have ever stayed in.We had 3 adults in our party so the small kitchenette was a giggle but we managed.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable & great location

reviews.text: Highly recommended. Clean, comfortable and spacious rooms that are well appointed and modern (newly renovated?). I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.text: The surroundings are very picturesque. I enjoyed watching the sun set over the mountains from the bedroom.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a suite on the second floor in the preferred section (back from the road). I am not sure that being back from the road made that much of a difference. This place was great and the staff could not have been more accommodating. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Paradise Indeed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about our stay was just wonderful. We had a small individual cabin with microwave and fridge. Very comfortable and well appointed with Arts and Crafts wood-themed mountain style interior. A nice little gas-powered iron stove to keep us warm when the temperature went down. We felt like we were living in a story book. The grounds were very attractive and neat with lots of plantings and flowers; the caretaker was constantly at work to make it so. The lobby and attached library were very attractive in with a vintage mountain style. The staff was very helpful in terms of making reservations at the various great restaurants nearby. It was very convenient to Lake Louise and the chateau as well as the little shopping center down near the highway. Also not far from Lake Moraine.
reviews.title: Simply amazing
Beautiful but expensive
reviews.text: This was the highlight of all accommodations on our trip through BC and Alberta. The lodge is extremely clean and cozy. The rooms are decorated in a warm-hearted, rustic way. It was spacious and fully equipped. The view was beautiful from the balcony - there is nothing nicer than a hot cup of coffee watching the mountains during sunset. The staff was very kind and helpful. We absolutely loved the little morning goodies (coffee and granola bars) available at the reception. They raise your mood for the whole day!

reviews.title: Love our cabin
reviews.text: Our cabin is so cute and cozy that I want to stay here forever. We came for one night and were thrilled to be able to extend and stay another night. The cabin is clean, pleasantly decorated, has a shower and a large deep soaking tub plus a full kitchen. My only complaint would be that the bathroom fan is noisy and comes on anytime you turn the light on. To solve this problem I moved a small lamp into the bathroom which provided a very soft light that was just right for soaking in the tub! The entire property here is very nice and inviting plus you won't pay the prices they charge for the small rooms at the Fairmont!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lake Louise is an expensive area to stay in. We chose the Paradise Lodge because of the location and a somewhat lower cost. We stayed in a preferred Fairview suite. The property is nice and our room had a partial view of the mountains. It was away from the road and quiet. This room was spacious and had a full kitchen. The property has no pool or hot tub. Some units have views of the forest which I think might have been preferable. The front desk staff were very helpful and provided a fan when it was hot as there is no air conditioning. It is a short drive to Lake Louise and Moraine Lake.
reviews.title: Location, service, value

reviews.text: My sister and I came for a visit of a couple of days and greatly enjoyed the place. The room and bathroom are well equiped. Even the staff sorted our cosmetics in a comfortable manner in the bathroom and they go out of their way to be friendly of service.
reviews.title: Our great stay in Lake Louise

reviews.text: Especially the staff at the front desk is outstanding and friendly and make you feel that they really care about you.
reviews.title: Paradise Lodge and Bungalows
Very nice accomodation
reviews.text: When we mentioned something that we keep shabbat and if they could leave the light on, the lady at the front desk asked what else she could do for us to make us comfortable.

description: Paradise Lodge and Bungalows offers a unique setting of individual cabins and suites in the heart of the Canadian Rockies. Located only 1 Km from Lake Louise and 14 time Alberta Housekeeping Award winner, Paradise Lodge and Bungalows exceeds expectations. Attention to detail and a welcoming atmosphere makes a destination to come back to.
